channel.title: Trigonometric Identities Problems :\
channel.description:
Ok, my teacher today gave us the lecture for basic trig identities, but we didn't have time to finish, and he still expects us to finish all the work, so there are some problems I need to learn to do to finish the assignment. These problems are:
[font=Verdana][u]1 + tan Θ[/u] + [u]1 + cot Θ[/u] 1 - tan Θ 1 - cot Θ
[u]1 + tan Θ[/u] 1 + cot Θ
2sec² Θ - 2sin² Θ * sec² Θ - sin² Θ - cos² Θ [/font] What you need to do is simplify each as much as possible.
I think where I mainly get stuck on the first one is after I get to having like:
[font=Verdana][u]1 + (sin Θ / cos Θ)[/u] + [u]1 + (cos Θ / sin Θ)[/u] 1 - (sin Θ / cos Θ) 1 - (cos Θ / sin Θ)[/font]
I just can't remember how to simplify it farther because fractions bug me a little after not having algebra for a year :\
If you post to help me, please include each step you take. If you think a step needs explaining, go ahead and explain it, but I don't think you need to go into too much detail. I'm a good student, so I should understand it.

item.title: Trigonometric Identities Problems :\
item.dc:creator: @0wn3d_n00b Ooo Java
item.description:
@0wn3d_n00b wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:3, topic:85166”]1) Ok, this first one’s weird…I didn’t believe it until I checked with Derive, actually (thought I must have done something wrong).

1 + tan Θ + 1 + cot Θ
1 - tan Θ 1 - cot Θ

1 + (sin Θ / cos Θ) + 1 + (cos Θ / sin Θ)
1 - (sin Θ / cos Θ) 1 - (cos Θ / sin Θ)

(cos Θ / cos Θ) + (sin Θ / cos Θ) + (sin Θ / sin Θ) + (cos Θ / sin Θ)
(cos Θ / cos Θ) - (sin Θ / cos Θ) (sin Θ / sin Θ) - (cos Θ / sin Θ)

(cos Θ + sin Θ) / cos Θ + (sin Θ + cos Θ) / sin Θ
(cos Θ - sin Θ) / cos Θ (sin Θ - cos Θ) / sin Θ

Multiply the left expression by cos Θ / cos Θ and the right expression by sin Θ / sin Θ

cos Θ + sin Θ + sin Θ + cos Θ
cos Θ - sin Θ sin Θ - cos Θ

Invert the denominator by multiplying the right expression by -1 / -1

cos Θ + sin Θ + -sin Θ * cos Θ
cos Θ - sin Θ cos Θ - sin Θ

0 / cos Θ - sin Θ = 0

  1. You can use the same method as above to solve #2.

1 + tan Θ
1 + cot Θ

(cos Θ / cos Θ) + (sin Θ / cos Θ)
(sin Θ / sin Θ) + (cos Θ / sin Θ)

(cos Θ + sin Θ) / cos Θ
(sin Θ + cos Θ) / sin Θ

This time, divide the top and bottom by (cos Θ + sin Θ) - ie Multiply the expression by [1 / (cos Θ + sin Θ)] / [1 / (cos Θ + sin Θ)]

1 / cos Θ
1 / sin Θ

sin Θ / cos Θ = tan Θ

2sec[sup]2[/sup] Θ - 2sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ * sec[sup]2[/sup] Θ - sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ - cos[sup]2[/sup] Θ

2sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ * sec[sup]2[/sup] Θ would be 2sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ * 1/cos[sup]2[/sup] Θ = 2tan[sup]2[/sup] Θ. Now, note that 2sec[sup]2[/sup] Θ - 2tan[sup]2[/sup] Θ = 2(sec[sup]2[/sup] Θ - tan[sup]2[/sup] Θ) = 2(1) = 2

2 - sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ - cos[sup]2[/sup] Θ

2 - (sin[sup]2[/sup] Θ + cos[sup]2[/sup] Θ)

2 - (1)

1

Hmm, that was a long post :P[/quote]
Why are you so smart? Its very scary
